node.statement: (Regularized identity in Boltzmann ratio form) On the Skorokhod coupling space (Omega, F, P) from node 1.6.3.2, with Phi_eps -> Phi P-a.s., law(Phi_eps) = mu_eps, law(Phi) = mu, define Y_eps := exp(Psi_eps^{ren}(Phi_eps)) and W_eps := exp(L_eps(Phi_eps)) where L_eps(phi) = 2 delta_m_eps^2 <psi_eps, phi_eps> (node 1.5.1). For each eps > 0 and every bounded measurable G, the regularized Radon-Nikodym identity (node 1.3) with K_eps = -log E_{mu_eps}[exp(Psi_eps^{ren} + L_eps)] (node 1.5.2) gives: E_P[G(Phi_eps + psi)] = E_P[G(Phi_eps) Y_eps W_eps] / E_P[Y_eps W_eps]. This is the Boltzmann ratio form: the pushforward expectation equals an exponentially tilted ratio, where Y_eps carries the convergent renormalized exponent and W_eps carries the divergent linear tilt L_eps. PROOF: E_P[G(Phi_eps + psi)] = E_{mu_eps}[G(phi+psi)] = E_{mu_eps}[G R_eps] (node 1.3) = E_{mu_eps}[G exp(Psi_eps^{ren} + L_eps + K_eps)] = exp(K_eps) E_{mu_eps}[G exp(Psi_eps^{ren} + L_eps)] = E_{mu_eps}[G exp(Psi_eps^{ren} + L_eps)] / E_{mu_eps}[exp(Psi_eps^{ren} + L_eps)] = E_P[G(Phi_eps) Y_eps W_eps] / E_P[Y_eps W_eps], using exp(K_eps) = 1/E_{mu_eps}[exp(Psi_eps^{ren} + L_eps)] and law(Phi_eps) = mu_eps.
